Node.definition: to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= long strip of writing material made by sewing together sheets of papyrus or parchment; this strip was then rolled up from one end or from both ends to form one or two cylinders; usually the ends of the scroll were attached to sticks, around which the scroll was rolled; an unrolled scroll was often about 10 meters in length and stood approximately 23 25 centimeters high; the term מְגִלַּת־סֵפֶר seems to be the more complete term for a book scroll, as it occurs at the beginning of passages in which scrolls play a roll; the shorter term מְגִלָּה is used after that
= process by which an object moves through the air

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= long strip of writing material made by sewing together sheets of papyrus or parchment; this strip was then rolled up from one end or from both ends to form one or two cylinders; usually the ends of the scroll were attached to sticks, around which the scroll was rolled; an unrolled scroll was often about 10 meters in length and stood approximately 23 25 centimeters high; the term מְגִלַּת־סֵפֶר seems to be the more complete term for a book scroll, as it occurs at the beginning of passages in which scrolls play a roll; the shorter term מְגִלָּה is used after that
= process by which an object moves through the air
= the greater or greatest of two or more dimensions of an object

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which the name of a deity is invoked and asked to punish a wrong doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so
literally: to go out; hence: = process by which an event starts taking place, originating from a certain deity, person, or place

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

Node.gloss: to be removed|to be banished|to be free|to be innocent|to go unpunished
Node.definition: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which people are forcefully removed from their community|= state or process in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

Node.gloss: to be removed|to be banished|to be free|to be innocent|to go unpunished
Node.definition: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which people are forcefully removed from their community|= state or process in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
literally: to bring out; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause an event to start taking place
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue
= state in which humans, animals, or objects stay in a certain place for an indefinite amount of time

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
literally: to finish; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause heavy damage to objects to the extent that they are almost gone

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment|read עָוֹן (עָוֹן)

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a round flat object ► used to cover a container|= a quantity of bread that is baked as one piece
= a heavy bluish grey soft metal, ≈ associated with heavy weight
= causative action by which humans or forces take hold of objects and cause them to rise up from a certain location
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which a countable entity is one in number
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= a container with the capacity of 1 ephah (see [a])

= opening of a container

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

= large bird with long legs and a long neck; the white stork has a white body and black wings, whereas the black stork is a glossy brownish black color with a white belly; both varieties have a red beak and legs; both types spend most of the time on the ground or in shallow water searching for food; the white stork eats mainly locusts, grasshoppers, and other insects, as well as frogs, lizards, and the chicks of ground nesting birds, whereas the black stork prefers fish and frogs but also eats the same things as the white stork; ◄ |iCiconia ciconia|i* or |iCiconia nigra|i*; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a container with the capacity of 1 ephah (see [a])
= the area separating two or mores locations

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= the area separating two or mores locations

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= causative action or process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or objects to move forward, usually towards a specific destination

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a container with the capacity of 1 ephah (see [a])

= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= region; ◄ in Mesopotamia

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use
= a firm location, suitable for building upon
